newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde June 25.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde June 25.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.

-- Interior Minister Jean-Pierre Chevenement calls for a "firm but generous" immigration policy, says procedure by which children born in France of foreign parents have to request French nationality under a 1993 law is "useless" and causes excess paperwork.
-- Vincent Bollore, chairman of the Rivaud group, to speed up reshuffling the group's structure, which he said was estimated to be worth some 10 to 15 billion francs.

-- The Association of Eurotunnel shareholders, headed by Christian Cambier, may vote in favour of the financial restructuring to be approved at a July 10 meeting, on condition the Channel tunnel concession is extended.
-- Dassault Systemes to buy U.S. computer software firm SolidWorks through a share swap estimated around $310 million.
-- Paribas subsidiary Compagnie Bancaire offers to buy out its two units, Cardif and Locabail for a maximum investment of three billion francs.
